intro: Werauhia camptoclada, commonly known as the clustered werauhia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a dense, water-holding cup. The plant produces striking inflorescences with brightly colored flowers, often in shades of red, orange, or yellow. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found growing on tree trunks or in rocky areas. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a popular subject in botanical studies and horticulture.
